intro: Mesembryanthemum ruschiorum, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers that open in response to light. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are edible and often used in culinary applications. Its fleshy leaves and drought-resistant nature make it well adapted to arid environments. Mesembryanthemum ruschiorum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in sandy soils.
